intro: Pultenaea brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Pultenaea brachyphylla is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
